A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Wow. What an experience. After J.J. Abrams recreated the mold\, reminding us why we fell in love with Star Wars in the first place\, it was bold for Kathleen Kennedy to allow Rian Johnson to break the mold as wide open as he did and do something so new\, unpredictable\, and uncompromising. For a year filled with surprisingly bold entries into genre pictures from major studios (Logan\, Blade Runner 2049\, mother!\, Get Out\, etc.) you can count on Star Wars to deliver something that challenges the series’ conventions\, viewers’ expectations\, but handle with the best of grace. That being said\, not all of The Last Jedi’s swings are hits\, and a few moments feel like they were one rewrite away from landing strong.
